September 20,1926
6.3, 5 1 2
Mr. Joseph J.Phillips
Right of Way Agent
City
County of
San Francisco
San Francisco, California
Desr Sir:-In accordance with your request for a price on our
land situated at Millbrse,
we beg leave to submit the following,
providing satisfactory financial terms can be arranged.
We will deliver this land to the City and County of
San Francisco to be used as a Municipal Air Port, for the sum
of $1500. per acre, the ares included in this agreement to be
all of our land lying between the Pacific Gas and Electric
Company g High Tension Transmission Line Basement and our
eagerly boundary, reserving therefrom, however, a right-of-way
easement for rod purposes sixty feet in width along the
northwesterly and southeasterly boundaries.
We also agree that if satisfactory arrangements cannot
be made with the West Coast Porcelain Company for the use of
their spur; to include sufficient land for a spur track from
the present Southern Pacific Railroad to the proposed field
at the price per acre mentioned above.
In the event that the City and County of San Francisco
could not make the full payment at this time, we would consider
a proportion of deferred payments, provided that the City
and
County of San
Francisco paid 6% interest on
one deserred paymenus
and all taxes levied against the property.
Very truly yours,
BAYSIDE COMPANY
By.
